page.title: 06Crime in Louth
page.content: From our research on crime we understand that the crime rate in Louth is a minor problem. We interviewed the police. This showed us the commonest crimes are thefts and damage. Vandals are between the ages of 14 and 21. Shoplifting continues to be the commonest offence committed by juveniles. A local newspaper reporter was interviewed. She said the crimes which hit the headlines most are arson and vandalism. She thought by reporting crimes in the paper it prevented other crimes being committed. Heads were interviewed from four schools. They said the punishment should fit the crime. There doesn't seem to be a large amount of crime in Louth. It is still rising though, and probably will continue to do so in the future.
